lexUnit.name: delight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cause or source of great pleasure.

sentence.text: Delight that she could be stirred by another person .
Rain like maracas woke him in the morning , and so did a surge of delight that he would n't have to stay in .
One of the principal delights for visitors to the Cotswold Wildlife Park is the many fine trees .
One of the never mentioned delights of the silent cinema was that you crunched and sucked to your heart 's content , annoying nobody but the piano player .
It is time to introduce the Treasury to the delights of off-balance-sheet financing .
To the delight of the away fans , an unexpected victim is between the posts and a new song has entered their vocal repertoire .
The civil war exposed his pretensions to military expertise , to the delight of the Cavalier propagandists .
She used to say that Christmas Eve was her favourite day of the year , and her enthusiasm added to the delight of anticipation .
That did n't stop him roving , teasing , passing and crossing that bit better than anyone else on the field , a constant delight to the eye .
Art , history and landscape all combine to make Tuscany a region of unending delight to the informed , inquisitive and view lover alike .
The less squeamish members of the group had the delight of checking the others ' feet , while they sat with gritted teeth and eyes tight shut .
Then we 'll witness naturally to the delight of knowing him .
One of the delights of being on holiday is not having to look at the clock .
STRATHBEG is a naturalist 's paradise and a trout fisherman 's delight .
They then began to light bonfires , expressing their delight .
She heard Fen groan his own unbearable delight .
The Prince felt he was in the company of someone very special , took great delight in time spent talking to him , and was inspired by all that he heard .
Korda Marshall of RCA takes delight in the group 's approach .
He 's either suppressing his delight at his success or is genuinely pragmatic about it .
But , while Border expressed his delight with the form of strike bowler McDermott , Gooch admitted : ` We were just not capable of splitting Border and Mark Waugh when we needed to .
They stood up from their points-cleaning to watch the express pass when , to the delight of her comrades , one of them bellowed ` Mishka ! " to the train driver through a rolled-up magazine .
The animal seemed to take a perverse delight in terrorizing him .
Lie to me , and the gentleman behind you will probably break your fingers one by one , and very possibly the gentlemen wit the club will take a certain delight in knocking out your teeth . "
` I 'm afraid Marianne will take great delight in telling your story , Shae .
The story of the purchase of Sarah 's burial plot is comedy , and comedy frequently takes delight in debunking heroes .
This made my delight at finding King Felin 's tomb all the more great .
Naseby 's delight could not be contained .
The first programme , to our delight , fits the Festival 's German theme perfectly .
Going to the Secret Cove was , as it had been in her mother 's time , the child 's greatest delight .
Arrecife is small and surprisingly unspoilt , with a cheerful , flower-filled esplanade where an old fashioned roundabout operates all hours to children 's delight .
` Arthur 's garden is a delight , " said Wendy at his elbow .
I learned how to create atmosphere so that the classroom was a visual delight .
I certainly feel it was a great delight to him during the last days of his life .
It was our delight to dash those proud faces to the ground , to smite them with the sword and savage them with the axe , as if blood and agony could follow from every blow .
This small corner of the Caribbean is an unqualified and unexpected delight .
This is a region of endless delight for the informed , the inquisitive and the lover of culture . "
At home , after a Sunday supper of cold lamb , fried potatoes and pickled red cabbage , Aunt Edie was a further delight to the family .

A genial and stimulating host , his ` Homeric laugh " was the delight of a generation of international lawyers , politicians , officials , and young people who were entertained in his book-lined apartment in Geneva .
As the results came in , there was delight that the rest of the top 10 rafts all came from Herefordshire .
He is also a great friend of the Festival , and it will be a delight to have him with us again .
